part.line: In the space of one hour, photographers took of you 700 pictures.
part.narration: Yuki, her friends, and the producer rest in Yuki's hotel room. The laptop continues through the slide-show of photos. Raymond fans herself.
part.line: Finally, a photogenic game designer.
And here I thought there was no hope for our star culture.
The one that really saved me is Nozomi.
Well — She could have fixed the texture filtering at 3:10,
And this shirt would look more nicer in Raleway,
But I suppose she did good.
part.narration: The attendees continue to fan themselves. Raymond slumps and puts her hand over her eyes.
part.line: Guys, I'm getting tired of this video game thing.
There's just too much drama with the Ministry of Culture.
I've been looking to branch out.
And by "branch out," you mean flee the industry.
Well — uh —
Don't worry, it's already started in Japan.
Let's see, a position better than Executive Producer — how about —
Those poor artists are going to have to restructure so many sprites.
Finally, Sega's conference is over.
Now you can spend the rest of the week eating Puerto Rican sushi,
playing so-called "Award winners" on the show floor,
and enjoying the rest of your time in America without a hitch—
Down with the ESA!
